alert.note: Alert for Hinds; Rankin (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 29 at 7:59PM CDT until September 02 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Mississippi... Pearl River At Jackson affecting Hinds and Rankin Counties. For the Upper Pearl River...including Philadelphia, Edinburg, Carthage, Walnut Grove, Lena, Kosciusko, Ratliff`s Ferry, Ofahoma, Jackson...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pearl River At Jackson. * WHEN...Until Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 34 feet, Dozens of additional streets flood in downtown Jackson. At 35 feet, Some businesses are affected near Town Creek. River waters will flood some of the streets of Northeast Jackson subdivisions which are close to the river and a number of additional streets in downtown Jackson. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CDT Monday the stage was 34.9 feet and falling. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 PM CDT Monday was 35.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage on Thursday. Discharge from Ross Barnett Reservoir has been further reduced to around 42,000 cubic feet per second this evening. The Pearl River has crested and is now falling in the Jackson area from Highway 80 northward to the reservoir. Downstream, it is cresting in the area south of Jackson. - Flood stage is 28 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 34.9 feet on 4/10/1977. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Pearl River Jackson 28.0 34.9 Mon 7 pm CDT 34.2 31.5 26.8 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Forecast includes rainfall on the ground and 24 hours of additional rainfall. Additional information is available at www.water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=JAN The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning.
